WRITING.TEXT: A lot of people believe RF4, but while I found the amount of content and replayability impressive, I believe RF3 to be the best, personally. There was more depth to the characters, your relationships with those characters were less formulaic, and the story was engaging. It also introduced new and better combat functions than prior titles. Meanwhile, I have to nominate RF1 for the best dungeons. I found RF4's dungeons repetitive and predictable with unnecessarily small rooms, while RF3 and RF2 had good dungeons, but too few of them.

This is amazing. Honestly, it's especially amazing for people who are interested in using the voice clips for messing around in mods or remakes...just sayin' if you ever feel compelled to upload voice clips from RF1, that would be absolutely incredible. All in all, keep up the good work, this is cool!

WRITING.TITLE: Forte! (first time drawing manga)
WRITING.TEXT: New to Reddit, and wanted my first post to be in the Rune Factory subreddit. Here's some art I did of Forte early last year when I tried dipping my toes into the manga art style. Still quite proud of it, apart from the slightly awkward spacing of the right eye and the wacky shape and lack of depth on the left end of her visor. [Forte by subject7682](https://preview.redd.it/5y0bgmct2sk41.png?width=2544 amp;format=png amp;auto=webp amp;s=5ffea6908e65ff706623852115297ffeb43dd0c9)
Thank you!
Marjorie from rf3 remains worse, tho. You always get robbed before hearing "EEHEEHEE" as she looks at you with that goblin face.

WRITING.TITLE: Refamiliarized with Blender!
WRITING.TEXT: This was my way of finally familiarizing myself with Blender since the 2.8 update. I put it off for so long, and wow, is the update incredible. Happy with my result. https://reddit.com/link/fflt0b/video/mv9ixyedgjl41/player
Lil dark. I love it
All? This is great! If you mean in the whole series, it'd be cool to see a higher quality Sabrina or Rosalind!
With inverse ETFs, when one rises, the other falls. When JNUG rises, JDST falls, and vice versa.

Been a while since I've immersed myself in day trading terms and such, so if my understanding is off, someone let me know and correct me. But from what I remember, Inverse ETFs are essentially a bet on whether or not something will rise or fall. So in this case, when you buy into JNUG, you're saying "I think gold is going to do really well". Meanwhile with JDST, you're saying "I think gold isn't going to do very well". Consequently, when JNUG falls, JDST rises, and vice versa. JNUG will fall when the value of gold declines, because it means the bulls were wrong. Effectively, what this means is it's virtually pointless to hold both at the same time.

As a followup. If you're new to investing and not just new to this, I want to advise you to consider long-term investing. Many good strategies; I prefer a dividend strategy. A much safer approach, and in the end provides a higher yield and you pay less in taxes. I learned all of this the hard way when I thought I knew what I was doing (I didn't). Lost a near $400 in the stock market. What's more, there's no more perfect time than now to start a long term portfolio, while the Coronavirus has suppressed the market into a huge discount. Buy now and after all of this blows over you'll be sitting on a fat stack of cash. At the end of the day though, risk management is very important. So apply that to any and every method or strategy.
You're what happens when Willy Wonka puts TheReportOfTheWeek in the Taffy Puller.

That Samsung card you cursed with your disappointing penmanship may be the only "mail" I see in this picture. I'd also wager you picked it up off the counter in your kitchen dedicated to housing piles upon piles of scrap paper just like it; every generic-ass white family's got one.
You're the one in the class who always reminded the teacher about the test. You may also consider tweaking your username to "stupidpalegrin".

WRITING.TITLE: Oh you're ceiling gang? Name every spider-man film

WRITING.TEXT: Hoping for better dungeon mechanics, rather than only door switches and the like.

WRITING.TITLE: Unreal Engine 4 [4.24] - Rune Factory (1) Remake: Dev Vlog 1. I've been working on this project for a year now and wanted to start a Dev Vlog series for it. Introducing the project amp; building Kardia in this first one. Feedback welcome, and needed!

WRITING.TEXT: I love this! Esp. the mane on Thunderbolt.

Hoping to start on redrawing all of the character sprites soon! As for blurry graphics, if you're referring to the awful terrain textures you're seeing, I just threw that together so I could have a worldspace to work in for the time being.
Ah, yeah. The original sprites from ROM rips are so small for the DS they don't look so great here.
A fan project? Yeah; where it would get sticky is if I were to distribute it; which would, in the end if I'm able to see this all the way through, be up to copyright owners.

Exactly. The dialogue in the original was very blunt and left a lot to be desired when it came to character development. My challenge here would be staying true to the characters, but I'd absolutely love to write new quests/lines for them.

It's good feedback to hear! I already have them scaled down a tad, so restoring their scaling would be a piece of cake. Camera adjustments would be in order, too. Would just be some trial and error as development continues.

WRITING.TITLE: Employers of Reddit, what's the stupidest or most pretentious thing you've ever read off of a cover letter or application?

WRITING.TEXT: Another great actor lost to drugs and alcohol. Just reach out as much as you need us, Seth.

RF1 is amazing, but painfully outdated now (why I'm remaking it in my spare time). RF2 I have the best memories of. RF3 had the best story and characters (imo), with the drawback of being so short. RF4 is very involved, which to me can be a lot but certainly has its perks. Welcome back to the franchise. Hope you enjoy the game!
Trying to figure out where Ethelberd fits in...

Yeah, I posted my [first dev vlog](https://youtu.be/MnjlvquC4TY?t=55) a couple weeks back, and another is on the way soon that I'm also excited to share. Yup, no real character interaction in the first one...and everyone was robotic anyway... but the music and the dungeons and the challenging grind for forging the best weapons, what a treat it was.
I could do the model! Again, depending on the payment.
Make dat bread homie

WRITING.TITLE: Unreal Engine 4 [4.24] Rune Factory (1) Remake: Dev Vlog 2. Wanted to get this out earlier, but was determined to learn how to use some new editing software for it, first. Visual progress featured in this one as I redesign the inventory; enjoy!

WRITING.TEXT: Take it slow! RF3 is probably my personal favorite Rune Factory game, and I burned through it quickly. It DOES have replay value, but it is nevertheless a very short play in terms of the story; there are only 5 dungeons, and of course a labyrinth afterward iirc. Not suggesting to play less, but rather enjoy everything the game has to offer in the moment before moving onto the next thing. Hope you enjoy the game!

Haha; it's an official \*fan project\*. Release ever happening completely depends on a) me ever seeing it all the way through, which I hope to do! and b) a solid copyright owner agreement for distribution, which I'm not getting my hopes up for, just so I'm prepared. That aside, I started the project so I would know the ins and outs of how to make an original game of the same genre; so it all works out to create something, regardless. :)

It's a subject of discussion I see often on this subreddit. Some believe (very rightly) that it's a way they catered to a particular perverted audience, others deny that and assert that it's more likely they made Amber a bachelorette for the "younger audience." I personally also agree with the former assertion; to be quite candid, as a young boy growing up with these games, I wasn't fixated on the younger characters just because I was young like them, I remember being more fixated on characters who featured very mature female forms; RF1 Sabrina, RF2 Alicia, RF3 Pia/Evelyn, etc. "Younger audiences" of the game simply don't think that way, being in the position that they're in in life and being immersed in the (esp. if in the U.S.) very sexualizing culture that surrounds them. So yes, it is creepy. Lest literally has to explain what dating amp; love is to Amber. Freaks me out. And people who appeal to the lore of her perhaps being really really old to excuse the issue at hand of her having such childlike mannerisms amp; looks in tandem with being a marriage candidate is a bit sickening as well, imo.
ope
Old fuddyduddy
Neat stuff! You seem like the 1% of Ocarina players who bought one because "lol Zelda" and then actually stuck with it.

WRITING.TITLE: Haven't been able to upload a dev blog for Rune Factory Remastered in a while, but have things I'm eager to share! Here's a first look at the tools; adopted a more low-poly style for these. Some blade parts will appear metallic in-game. 3rd dev blog coming up in the near future.

WRITING.TEXT: So happy to hear of how others came to grow with and love the series. I've been playing since the 1st game, bought RFF within the last year and want to give it another go (and have yet to try ToD), but I was hooked the moment my brother and I entered a GameStop (imagine...) and each picked up a copy of the 1st game. We'd play all the time, filling in game flaws with our own imagination #8212; EG, our own dialogue wherever the games lacked. Sometimes I wonder how different our relationship might be if we hadn't grown up playing the series together almost 24/7.
Ask away, and I can answer what I can.
I only wanted to set them outside to get some sun. :(

RF4's dialogue feels to me like filler most of the time. It seems that what developers got from consumers was exclusively "we want more dialogue", and not "we want more good dialogue". The Y button was, second to my joystick, my most used button during the installment. RF2 and RF3 are a great example of good dialogue. Instead, RF4 just went for quantity over quality. Praying RF5 will feature more good dialogue.
Now that IS a hot take.

That was my attitude during 3 and 4, I think they spoiled the player too much. I enjoyed crafting in 1, though; hard to get a good weapon from some random chest. I was grinding for the next ingredient, and the next, until I got the great weapon I wanted. I am also turned off to the way RF4 handled crafting; a clever idea, having categories determine some items required to forge something rather than specific items, yet it took the thrill out of hunting down particular monsters for those specific items.
At least he's more merciful than Marjorie in RF3. \*shudders\*
I always mention this when someone hates on Jones. Marjorie perfectly exemplifies the U.S. Healthcare system. If only Sherman offered insurance services.

I want to see someone we once saw as young, grown old. Maybe see Nicholas from the first Rune Factory game as an elderly man. Unfortunately though, I can't recall quite how far apart in time each game takes place from each other.

WRITING.TITLE: I paid a freelance translator on Fiverr to translate the Japanese opening track from the first Rune Factory game. Ladies and Gentlemen, we FINALLY have it! Here's the subtitled anime intro.

WRITING.TEXT: I think I saw this along my journey, didn't have a way of verifying its validity well so I pressed on with the freelancer. Suppose I never referred back to it to compare with the result I had ordered, but I have to say, in retrospect they strung the context of the words together very well. Thank you for linking this - having more sources will only make my arrangement for RFR easier to construct!

If you're good at something, never do it for free. Others may also need that work if someone is looking for a hire like them to do it. Additionally, I'm hesitant on asking volunteer work of anyone, as it is.
RF3 is my favorite, in terms of its cast of characters.

Glad someone was able to help you find it - meanwhile, as a tip, [spriters-resource.com](https://spriters-resource.com) is an excellent place to check for this stuff first thing, in case you weren't aware of it (looks like Forte hasn't been ripped there yet, though).
No harm done, friend!

For me it's second to RF3. :) the buildup in it will always give me the chills. They did not, as far as I am aware. There are MULTIPLE places online saying that the song, called "Rune", is sung by an artist called "Lil'" or sometimes spelled "\~Lil", but never found anything on that. However, I recently (as in literally right now lol) found it's actually stylized "LIL" and was able to dig up some limited information on them. The Japanese pop duo is comprised of producer Toshimichi Tsuge (aka TSUGE) and Ucio (aka Yushio), and looks like single discography of "Rune" is not in sight as it must have been a deliberate contract to make the song for the game. Regardless, here are a few links to that limited information about the duo: [https://www.youtube.com/user/lil](https://www.youtube.com/user/lil) [https://www.discogs.com/artist/1771232-LIL-5](https://www.discogs.com/artist/1771232-LIL-5) [https://www.youtube.com/user/ucosong](https://www.youtube.com/user/ucosong) [https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LIL](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LIL)

Who knows, if Nick Robinson was willing to [take a trip to Japan just to put a Super Monkey Ball sticker on a SEGA lobby wall](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pNBsPb0ZLM0), maybe contacting him to see if he'd try and track down that recording to the source wouldn't be so much a stretch of possibility (outside the context of travel there from the U.S. right now)....

I've always thought the implementation of axes and hammers in some of the games was cheap, the way they often ride off of the movements of their respective tools. If it weren't for that, I would use them all the time; they just look so awesome, and so often all for what? Hopefully HAKAMA will reevaluate that method of implementation for RF5.

My advice is to try 1 first thing. It has a lot of ugly hindrances that the series improved on over time, but it would be unfortunate to spoil yourself with those improvements and not be able to see the beauty in the first title due to the distracting control layout and such. It has the best dungeons in the series by far. If however, those hindrances are too much to bear, skip 1 and play RF3 or RF2 in whatever order. RF3 is, gameplay-wise and character cast-wise, the best imo. RF2 however, is very memorable and the child protagonist(s) are written in very well. As a GAME, RF3 gt;RF2, that one's just hard for me to say as I have so much nostalgia playing RF2 24/7 as a kid.

WRITING.TITLE: Today I implemented knockback, enemy juggling, and attack bias correction (for when Raguna's attacks are an unfair hair away from hitting enemies) into my combat system. It's starting to feel good to fight in the game, which is a great sign! Can't wait to share more soon.

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks!

Remake! I put [Dev Vlogs](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLI4a6NIVbpqJZ--EYopvfRon7okPkwUya) up for it now and then. I've been crafting it primarily so I can get a frame of reference for making my own original game in the genre.
Unreal! :)
Thank you for this blessed information!
Thanks for the feedback!

I am quite skeptical, myself. Given this over-shoulder 3D feel didn't go 100% for all fans with Frontier and ToD, I have to wonder why they chose to close a 8-9 year gap between titles with that formula--and for one of the main installments, at that. Regardless, it definitely has visuals going for it, the colors make me happy. Hoping to see some quality improvements in the gameplay in future trailers, though, personally; namely the farming.

In summary, I'd like to construct a game of the genre that is my own, someday. I decided to learn how in UE4 by recreating the first Rune Factory game. I upload [Dev Vlogs](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLI4a6NIVbpqJZ--EYopvfRon7okPkwUya) now and then. No guarantee for a release of this fan project, but if I see it through to the end I'll consider reaching out to HAKAMA about it -- regardless, it all comes out to creating my own original farming slice-of-life rpg game in the future.

WRITING.TITLE: After a few months of work and getting around my full time job hours, I've finally finished enough battle amp; animation mechanics to create Dev Vlog 4 for my fan remake of Rune Factory (2006)! Thank you to those who've been following the project; I love this community so much.
We met a Red who was in hospital so we wore favorite hat to support

WRITING.TEXT: IKR!? I've been waiting so long for a moment like this :)
Haha, yeah, it was quite a task. That's why I'll be cutting back and doing casual dev videos a little more often - but I'm so glad you liked the editing in this one!
Sad to inform you it's a remake of the FIRST one, but I'm glad you like it!
